file_content.text: I need a vacation....
What in blazes happened down there? The entire moon is breaking apart as we speak!
This was a very serious threat, of course, but... I think this goes a bit beyond our acceptable degree of force.
Unfortunately, destroying Directive Seven meant destroying the moon.
I did what I had to.
I don't know, Master Jedi. This was very extreme.
I only struck our enemies, but they carried a heavy cost even in death.
It was regrettable.
"Heavy cost" and "blew up a moon" aren't the same thing.
Destruction of the primary target--the leader of Directive Seven--resulted in unintended consequences.
I can explain, sir.
Unintended consequences? Would your CO buy that?
This level of service is normally extra--but I like you.
And at no additional charge.
Have you lost your mind?
I stop the biggest genocide in history, and you're upset about that worthless rock?
I just saved the galaxy!
I did what I was sent to. Collateral damage isn't my problem.
Back off.
Collateral damage? You blew up a moon!
The moon was destroyed through Mentor's carelessness, not your agent. Cast blame where it belongs.
The moon's destruction was purely a result of Directive Seven's actions. Your agents are blameless.
Ugh. I'm sorry. I just wasn't expecting... this situation has been very difficult. But you faced that difficulty and succeeded.
You've saved more lives than anyone will ever know. The people of the Republic--of the entire galaxy--are alive today because of you.
Protecting innocent people is what the Jedi live for.
It was nothing.
That doesn't mean you don't deserve gratitude.
I simply acted as the Force guided me.
It was the will of the Force.
Well, good thing the Force was on our side, then.
Havoc Squad is always happy to serve, Director.
Just doing my duty.
And serve you have. I won't forget it.
If you want to give me some kind of certificate to that effect....
Can I get that in writing?
I'm afraid not. This op stays strictly off the record. People will sleep better not knowing.
Those droids came a lot closer to having their revolution than I would've liked.
I'm just glad it's over.
Close or not, it didn't happen. That's all that matters.
I assume that someone who saves the entire galaxy receives a great deal of... gratitude.
So what's my reward?
Given that we can never reveal this situation to anyone, your reward will have to stay under the table. But it will be substantial.
We also owe you a great debt of thanks--C5-M3, was it? Without you, we would never have had a chance.
I would be proud to offer you an assignment here in the Republic fleet as soon as you've had some standard maintenance checks.
Assignment? Nonsense. I belong to no one--I will leave and go where I please.
I'm... sorry, but I'm not sure I can allow that. You have the same programming as the other renegades--letting you roam free would be extremely dangerous.
C5 is no threat to us, Director. He's earned the right to do as he wishes.
Let C5 go.
If you're willing to take responsibility for the matter... by all means. C5, you are free to go.
As if I needed your leave....
Thank you for speaking on my behalf. It's good to know that some organics can understand.
I've actually enjoyed meeting you, despite the circumstances. Perhaps we'll meet again someday.
Thanks again for your help. It's been... interesting. Take care.
This droid has the potential to repeat the entire situation. He can't be released.
C5 is too dangerous.
But I gave everything I have to protect you....
I am a free being....
It's for the best--we'll treat him well.
Let's hope the next time we meet is under better circumstances. Thanks again for your assistance--take care.
Your shuttle is waiting--and time is running out.
...Targets of opportunity are AA, comms and shields. But remember: We're diversions first and hotshots second. Questions?
Is there a reason you're not telling us who we're hitting, sir? I mean, if it's just more Imps, I don't see why--
The target is classified, the mission is classified, you being here is classified. Everything is classified. Just get to your fighters and do your job, huh?
Surely those men deserve to know what they're fighting against?
Why hide the truth?
Your tension will only distract you from our task, my friend.
Release your apprehensions.
I'll relax when we're done, Master Jedi. I won't promise anything beforehand.
If those men are going to fight and die out there, they deserve to know what it's for, sir.
Don't send them in blind.
We can't have this situation leaking out and starting a panic. They're protecting the Republic--that's all they should need.
With charms like that, I'm surprised you chose to work as a shadowy government agent.
Not very smooth, are you?
This is no time for sarcasm. We have a job to do.
Are you ready to get started, Director?
Let's begin.
Ah, yes--thank you for coming. Let's get right into it.
Listening to pointless briefings is a waste of my time.
I didn't come here to wait.
All right, all right... just let me make sure the doors are sealed.
You know the basics: A faction of renegade droids called "Directive Seven" is planning to exterminate every form of biological life in the galaxy.
Not all of the renegades agree, though. Someone inside the movement wants us to take them down. He, she or it has been our primary source of intel.
You don't even know this traitor's identity?
"He, she or it"?
Directive Seven only accepts droids, as far as we know, but the traitor never gave personal information--just intel on the movement.
Having someone on the inside will give us a big advantage.
One ally is better than none.
That's our hope, at least. So far, all of the intelligence has checked out.
This could easily be nothing but a huge ambush.
Sounds like a trap.
We aren't new at this. We've triple-checked every piece of information--it's all solid.
Thanks to our unnamed friend, we know Directive Seven's ultimate weapon: a coded signal that can forcibly convert any droid to their cause.
That's how they're planning to wipe us out--they're going to transmit that signal across the entire galaxy, turning every droid into a mindless killing machine.
They'll start a galaxy-wide revolution in a matter of seconds.
Incredible.
Exactly. Our only chance is to strike now, before it's too late.
If we block the droids' transmissions, their plan won't work.
Can't we jam the signal?
No such luck--their tech is too sophisticated. Our only option is to destroy the source.
Droids turning other droids into killers just like that? Seems farfetched.
That can't be true.
They've already used their signal to decimate three entire colonies. We can't afford to wait--we have to strike now.
Their headquarters is on a moon called Zadd, in the Unknown Regions. But the defenses are too thick for any kind of orbital attack.
The only way to stop Directive Seven's plan is on the ground: Make a big diversion and slip a strike team through their defenses. That's where you come in.
I will not allow these droids to harm another living creature.
You can count on me.
Subtlety and precision are a Jedi's specialty.
Perfect.
Get me on the ground, and I'll do what needs to be done, sir.
Understood.
Sounds like everything I heard about you was right.
I kinda figured I wouldn't be part of the diversion.
Makes sense.
Ahem. No. That would be a waste of time, wouldn't it?
I guess our options are this, or a galaxy-wide droid massacre....
If that's what it takes.
That's the situation we're faced with.
I should've known that taking down an entire revolution wouldn't be easy.
This doesn't sound fun.
There's a reason I only called the best.
We've got a shuttle ready to take you in and starfighters to cover you. But I'm afraid that's as much as we can do.
There are trillions of lives on the line here. Everything we have--the entire Republic--depends on you. Good luck.
Sorry. This isn't a good time.
